intro: Apodanthes panamensis, commonly known as the Panama apodanthe, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. Apodanthes panamensis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
